items.title: National park's wetlands overrun as climate change causes seas to rise
items.description: In wet season, Jonathan and his family have to drive, boat and drive again if they want to reach town. The remote NT traditional owner says nature has long been warning us about climate change, "but nobody's listening".

items.title: Exhausted passengers arrive home after luxury cruise liner runs aground
items.description: About 80 passengers on the Coral Adventurer are flown home after the cruise ship ran aground on a reef off Papua New Guinea.

items.title: First apprenticeship 'hell' for tradie who wants hazing to stop
items.description: TV presenter and former builder Barry Du Bois is lobbying Canberra for change.

items.title: How illegitimate regulators operate in the name of a tiny African island
items.description: An ABC investigation has identified several individuals involved in a network of illegitimate corporate regulators and service firms.

items.title: 'Teetering on the brink': Fears of Middle East conflict after Saudi strikes in Yemen
items.description: The UAE has denied shipping weapons to Yemeni separatists after Saudi-led forces said they had bombed arms at the port city of Mukalla.

items.title: Floodwaters rise in outback Queensland as heavy rainfall continues in the north
items.description: Bureau of Meteorology predicts more rain in the state's north over the coming days, as graziers brace for stock losses and a man is found dead in a flooded vehicle at Normanton.

items.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Hayley thrashes northern Kimberley coast
items.description: The storm has been downgraded after bringing severe winds and heavy rain to parts of the north-west Kimberley.

items.title: 'A rule is a rule': Protest to be heard against current Sydney to Hobart leader
items.description: The two-person crewed yacht on the brink of winning the prestigious overall handicap prize in the Sydney to Hobart race is the subject of a protest by a rival, which could potentially deny it victory.

items.title: JFK's granddaughter Tatiana Schlossberg dies aged 35
items.description: Tatiana Schlossberg revealed in an essay published in November that she had a rare form of terminal leukaemia.

items.title: Stocks that would have earned you the most money on the ASX in 2025
items.description: Several gold, lithium and other mining stocks have seen their share price double, and even triple, in 2025 as Australia's share market has had a much better than expected year despite tariffs, economic uncertainty and Donald Trump's ongoing unpredictability.

items.title: Australian-made content and cheaper medication among January 1 changes
items.description: New Year's Day brings a host of new laws, regulations and guidelines into effect. Here's a quick breakdown of some of the changes.

items.title: Denmark becomes first country in world to end letter delivery
items.description: After 401 years, the Danish postal service has ended letter deliveries as the country fully embraces the digital age.

items.title: Tokyo venture allows housebound people to 'work while teleporting'
items.description: Ory Yoshifuji's Tokyo business employs housebound individuals to operate robots as waitstaff at a cafe and as personal tour guides in the city.

items.title: Would you invest in your favourite craft beer? Nearly 1,000 people have
items.description: Brewer Richard Jeffares's Victorian company raised about $2.5 million from 993 investors in a matter of days through a method called crowd-sourced funding, also known as equity crowdfunding.

items.title: Nuclear-capable missiles deployed in Belarus, Russia claims
items.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, a staunch ally of the Kremlin, announced the deployment of the Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missiles earlier this month.

items.title: 'Shocking at every level': Watchdog deleted quotes after Sportsbet pressure
items.description: Gambling giant Sportsbet pressured the Australian Communications and Media Authority into "watering down" enforcement announcement, the ABC can reveal.

items.title: Quiz: How much sport do you remember from 2025?
items.description: It was another big year in sport, with Ashes series, world cups, world championships and a long-awaited comeback.

items.title: Koala stalking causes stress for koalas in Byron Bay
items.description: Large crowds of tourists gather daily at the bottom of trees home to koalas in Byron Bay, leaving the animals stressed and their habitat trampled.

items.title: What should you do during a violent mass attack?
items.description: The mass shooting in Bondi and other incidents of mass violence around the world have highlighted that violence can strike anywhere. Here are some expert tips on how to escape, hide, and stay safe.

items.title: Oil and gas giant knowingly shed kilograms of plastic into the ocean
items.description: Documents reveal one of Australia's biggest oil and gas companies knowingly shed plastic into the ocean for two months before notifying the offshore regulator.

items.title: Robbers use drill to steal $52m of cash and jewellery from German bank
items.description: According to police, the robbers drilled their way into the underground vault room of the savings bank from a parking garage.

items.title: Eurostar cancellations wreak havoc on winter travel, New Year's Eve celebrations
items.description: A disruption on Tuesday prompted the rail company to request train customers postpone their journeys until another time.

items.title: Desperate for workers, some mechanics are looking overseas
items.description: The automotive repair industry says it is dealing with a major labour and skills shortage, and some mechanics are looking overseas for workers.

items.title: Piastri misses F1 Driver of the Year top three as Verstappen wins
items.description: Max Verstappen may not have won the F1 world title, but his fast finish to the year wins him Driver of the Year for the fifth straight year, while Oscar Piastri's disappointing end to the season is mirrored in the voting.

items.title: Turner stranded short of ton, but helps rescue Perth's BBL season
items.description: Ashton Turner narrowly misses out on a maiden BBL century as he helps launch Perth to a crucial 71-run win over the Sydney Thunder.
